column2: ttyme03, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Considering the several alternatives that are prescribed to empty the bowel - HalfLytely-Bisacodyl Bowel Kit is EASY to use.  Like another reviewer- I was worried about the potential stomach distresses -namely nausea and vomiting -that are common side affects with this drug.  Needless to say - my doctor's office gave some very simple but effective advice (besides what was on the instructional sheet): a)eat lightly the evening before; b)ingest 8oz+ fluid every hour on the hour until time to drink solution (to tablet at 12, started drinking solution at 4); c) chill and mix each dose with a packet of Crystal Light lemonade powder; d) pace yourself - not everybody can drink that stuff at a rate of 8oz/10min. I did 8oz in 20 min increments and kept moving around instead of sitting.  Basically, I did what I was told.  And having consumed 130oz of clear/light fluids over an 11 hour period (boulion, juice, water, popsicles) - I did not have one ounce of trouble with this prescription.  No side effects, and no bad taste!  You get sick of drinking it after about the 4th or 5th glass. But that is about the worse that happens. The only "side affect" I had was the one that was intended - watery stools. Everything was textbook perfect. I couldn't be happier for being prescribed this versus GoLytely, NuLytely,or the GATORADE/DULCOLAX 5mg/MIRALAX regiment,or a number of other horrible concoctions that are prescribed.

column2: Elizabeth, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
